properties.description: www.swansea.gov.uk/brynmillcommunitycentre, https://brynmillcommunitycentre.org.uk/, www.facebook.com/brynmillcommunitycentre/ 07966 246 033, fiona.hughes@swansea.gov.uk Thursday Breakfast Club - every Thursday morning between 11.00am - 1.00pm: ; A group of residents, from young children through to those mature in years; A space to enjoy company, seek advice and information; Club is visited monthly by a therapist who provides neck / hand massage to attendees; Free wifi; Free charging points for phones or other devices; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Refreshments available; breakfast rolls with tea / coffee / light refreshments £2.00; as much as you want tea / coffee / soft drinks £1.00; ; Drinking water available; Visitors welcome to bring own food / drinks; Book borrowing / book swap; Advice, information and signposting; local councillor Allan Jeffrey available weekly at the Breakfast Club via an informal surgery; local area coordinator Fiona Hughes attends weekly; Swansea University welfare staff available monthly to provide support and information to students in attendance; local PCSO attends whenever able to provide information and advice to residents; ;
properties.title: Brynmill Community Centre

properties.address: St Helens Ground, Bryn Road, Brynmill SA2 0AR
properties.contact: www.swanseaveteranshub.org.uk/our-services, Facebook Swansea Veterans Hub, Twitter @swanseaveterans, Instagram Swansea_veterans_hub info@swanseaveteranshub.org.uk, 07916 227 411
properties.description: Open every Saturday 10.00am - 12.00pm, Tuesday 11.00am - 1.00pm, tea and coffee sessions for veterans and their families. Support is available. Our drop in hub holds coffee mornings where vulnerable veterans can come together in a non-threatening, comfortable environment, allowing our specialist volunteers to identify those most at risk, offer them wellbeing strategies, and signpost them to alternative therapies and treatments. ; Free charging points for phones or other devices; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Car parking; Games / board games; Outdoor space; Refreshments available; free tea and coffee available; food hampers available upon request; ; Drinking water available; Visitors welcome to bring own food / drinks; Television; Advice, information and signposting; Swansea Veterans' Hub (SVH) is a CIC formed 24 August 2021 by a small group of veterans who had themselves experienced mental health difficulties. The hub operates in partnership with several local organisations to provide mental health and wellbeing support and signposting for veterans and their families.; ;
properties.title: Swansea Veterans Hub

properties.address: Vivian Hall, Mumbles Road, Blackpill SA3 5AS
properties.contact: www.actionforelders.org.uk/, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn - @actionforelders stephanie.booth@actionforelders.org.uk, 03033 030132
properties.description: Every Monday, 1.00pm - 3.00pm A mix of exercise and social activities, including gentle exercise for all abilities, basic health advice and the chance to share your life and skills with other people. It is an opportunity to meet with people of similar age and interests and to get some suggestions to improve overall health and wellbeing in a friendly, helpful environment. The first hour will be hot beverages and food and the second hour will be gentle exercises. ; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Refreshments available; free hot beverages and food will be available some weeks; ; Visitors welcome to bring own food / drinks; Advice, information and signposting; health and wellbeing advice. Digital support can be arranged.; ;
properties.title: Action For Elders

properties.description: We are open every term time Thursday, 9.00am - 11.45am. Caffi Cynefin aims to bring people together promoting positivity, kindness and a sense of belonging. This Caffi is run by our wonderful pupils who are gaining experiences of the "real world of work". Come and join us! Caffi Cynefin is a place where all generations come together to relax, enjoy and reflect. We do not charge for our refreshments, but we will depend on donations to make this a sustainable and long term commitment. If you would like to volunteer or make any donations, please contact the school. ; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Refreshments available; we serve tea, coffee, squash, a selection of cakes, crumpets, teacakes and have a weekly healthy option available (but most prefer the cakes). We do not charge!; ; Drinking water available; Visitors welcome to bring own food / drinks; Advice, information and signposting; most weeks our Local Area Co-ordinator and local police often attend to offer support and advice; ;
properties.title: Caffi Cynefin

properties.address: Unit 1, Campion Gardens Village, Clyne Common SA3 3JB
properties.description: Daily, 9.00am - 4.00pm A warm friendly welcome with free wifi and ample seating space. Our residents are very welcoming, enjoy a chat and sharing stories. ; Free wifi; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Car parking; Games / board games; Refreshments available; we have both a restaurant/coffee shop and can offer refreshments at very reasonable prices, including tea, coffee and soft drinks; ;
properties.title: Memoirs

properties.description: Tuesday Chat meets in the Victoria Hall every fortnight, 10.00am - 12.30pm - a group for elderly members of our community but all are welcome to attend. Meet new friends. ; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Baby changing facilities; Refreshments available; tea and coffee is served throughout the morning along with cake and biscuits; ; Drinking water available;
properties.title: Mumbles Methodist Church

properties.description: Tuesday, 12.00pm - 2.00pm We are open for coffee with friends - expect a warm, friendly welcome, a hot drink and cake, all free of charge. Community councillors always attend so you can also raise any local issues and we will do our best to help. ; Free charging points for phones or other devices; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Refreshments available; all refreshments are free - hot drinks and cake; ; Drinking water available; Book borrowing / book swap; Advice, information and signposting; community councillors are in attendance, as well as often PCSOs and the Local Area Coordinator. We will do our best to help with any local issues by connecting people to the right port of call; ;
properties.title: Ostreme Community Centre - Mumbles Community Council

properties.address: Linden Christian Centre, Elmgrove Road, West Cross SA3 5LD
properties.description: Monday, 9.30am - 11.30am Parent and Toddlers; 5.30pm - 7.00pm Youth Club Y6-Y9 (term time only), Wednesday, 11.00am - 12.30pm Brunch Club; 1.30pm - 3.30pm Yoga, Thursday, 12.00pm - 2.00pm Community Meal (first Thursday each month), Friday, 11.00am - 3.00pm Dementia Choir open to all who enjoy singing and are patient with people living with dementia Activities at different times will be more suited to different age groups and interests but people will always get a warm, friendly welcome. Yoga is free but please let us know on Facebook that you will be coming. ; Free wifi; Free charging points for phones or other devices; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Baby changing facilities; Car parking; Disabled parking; Refreshments available; free hot drinks are available during most activities; brunch is a cooked breakfast; monthly community meals are a home cooked main and dessert; the toddler group has a suggested donation but this is not an expectation; ; Drinking water available; Free period products;
properties.title: Red Community Project - part of Linden Church
